channel.description: Lennox Lewis's long-awaited meeting with Mike Tyson seemed less likely than ever Friday after the Lewis camp ruled out the possibility for the foreseeable future. A senior help to the WBC and IBF success insisted that the the show-down "was not going to happen" as the two fighters ended up contracted to rival television companies. Lewis is 2 fights into a seven-contest deal with cable company Cinemax , while Tyson has an agreement with rival system Showtime . "It's a ridiculous contract -- the Tyson fight will not go ahead," said the aide. "He's based into his own contract and it's not going to take place." The Lewis camping had suggested Thursday that the fight end up being screened on HBO , a proposal which would force Tyson to compensate Showtime out of his or her cut of the bag. Tyson's manager Shelly Finkel said that Lewis's demands on the split associated with television cash were "laughable," adding that it was "clear that Lennox does not would like the fight." A compromise which would see each cable companies screening the fight simultaneously seems unlikely. "It would be essentially impossible, as there is simply no financial incentive for that companies to do so,In . said industry specialist Tom Umstead of Adjustable Channel News. "They would need to go through the In Demand submission house or eliminate them. "If they did which, they would have to make a deal individually with thousands of cable operators themselves which would be extremely hard from a distribution perspective," he included. Jason Oberlander, a publicist for Showtime, says the company ended up being willing to try to get to agreement with Cinemax . "Showtime is open to mediation. We are open to talks to work this out and about and see what we can do," he said.(Chemical)2001 The Linked Press. All Legal rights Reserved. Peru's embattled president, Alberto Fujimori, resigned while on a trip to Asia and has so far rejected to return to Lima. Secretary regarding State Madeleine Albright has delivered from a quick trip to Vienna where she held consultations with European leaders, though the girl wasn't able to meet with Yugoslavia's new president, Vojislav Kostunica.Prime Minister Ehud Barak has called for new elections in Israel, even as Israelis as well as Palestinians continue to kill one another  and, perhaps, kill any chance for tranquility between them anytime soon.Of course, there is much political news occurring within world capitals for anyone interested. Providing the matter is in the tennis courts, the cables via Embassy Row back to the world's foreign ministries are stuffed with speculation and supposition, explanations of how your electoral college and not the widely used vote is the important thing and maybe a few truthful confessions that most diplomats posted right here on temporary assignments are just as puzzled as the locals.
